name: 1 Hour Cinnamon Rolls with Aquafaba
description: Easy Homemade 1 hour Cinnamon Rolls. 1 Bowl Aquafaba Cinnamon Rolls! Vegan Cinnamon Rolls with Cashew cream frosting. Ready in 60 minutes. How to make cinnamon rolls. Vegan Soy-free Palm Oil free Breakfast Recipe. Makes 1 8 by 8 inch brownie pan or 9 inch pie pan. serves 6 to 9

video.name: VEGAN CINNAMON ROLLS WITH AQUAFABA | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Aquafaba Cinnamon Rolls. 60 Minute, 1 Rise, Make Ahead option! 
ðŸ’™ðŸ§¡ FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2016/04/1-hour-cinnamon-rolls.html
ðŸ’™ðŸ§¡ BUY MY COOKBOOK: https://veganricha.com/vrekaz

These cinnamon rolls are Soft and airy, need 1 Bowl, and have a Secret Ingredient. Aquafaba! Aquafaba is the liquid from a can of chickpeas (chickpea brine), that can be used to make meringues and can be used as egg substitute in some vegan baking. You can make aquafaba at home too by pressure cooking dried chickpeas in water. The viscous water remaining after the chickpeas are cooked, is aquafaba and can be frozen for future use. 

In these cinnamon rolls, aquafaba adds moisture to the rolls and also helps them rise quicker and rise more so you can get away with 1 rise Quicker Rolls. 

If you have time, use the 2 rise method as that makes the rolls even more fluffy and soft. Especially if you are using combination flours or whole grain flours, as those flours need more extra moisture and airy yeast action to keep them softer and not dense. 
Use frosting of choice. I like a cashew cream cheese style that is not all sugar :). This Recipe is also in my Book VR's Everyday Kitchen.
Vegan Soy-free Palm Oil-free(option) Breakfast Recipe

For a Gluten-free Version see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=npSGzSyCh3A

recipeIngredient: 1  packet active yeast (or 2 1/2 tsp active yeast)
2 tbsp oil (or use melted vegan butter. I usually use oil)
2.5 cups or more flour (I use unbleached white or a combination of white and wheat flour)
1 to 2 tbsp Oil  (or melted vegan butter)
1/3 cup or more coconut sugar  (or brown sugar)
Add some cardamom or nutmeg for variation

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180Âºc. Line a 8 by 8 inch brownie pan or 9 inch pie pan with parchment. Mix the first 5 ingredients under rolls until the sugar is mixed in. Let sit for a minute for the yeast to activate.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180Âºc. Line a 8 by 8 inch brownie pan or 9 inch pie pan with parchment. Mix the first 5 ingredients under rolls until the sugar is mixed in. Let sit for a minute for the yeast to activate.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the oil, nutritional yeast and mix in. Add 2 cups flour and salt and knead. Add more flour, few tbsps at a time to make a soft somewhat smooth dough. 4 to 6 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the oil, nutritional yeast and mix in. Add 2 cups flour and salt and knead. Add more flour, few tbsps at a time to make a soft somewhat smooth dough. 4 to 6 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll the dough out using additional flour into a 10 by 14 inch rectangle
recipeInstructions.name: Roll the dough out using additional flour into a 10 by 14 inch rectangle

recipeInstructions.text: Spray or brush oil or vegan butter on the rolled out dough. (use as much melted vegan butter as you like :)).Sprinkle sugar, cinnamon and salt evenly. Roll the dough tightly along the longer edge to make a cylinder.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray or brush oil or vegan butter on the rolled out dough. (use as much melted vegan butter as you like :)).Sprinkle sugar, cinnamon and salt evenly. Roll the dough tightly along the longer edge to make a cylinder.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice using a pizza cutter or floss or a serrated knife. Place the slices in a parchment lined brownie baking pan or pie pan. Spray or brush oil on top. Cover lightly with a towel and Let the pan sit near the warm oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until just about doubled. Remove the towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice using a pizza cutter or floss or a serrated knife. Place the slices in a parchment lined brownie baking pan or pie pan. Spray or brush oil on top. Cover lightly with a towel and Let the pan sit near the warm oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until just about doubled. Remove the towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350f / 180Âºc for 21 to 23 minutes or until golden on some edges.(just about starting to get golden)
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 350f / 180Âºc for 21 to 23 minutes or until golden on some edges.(just about starting to get golden)

recipeInstructions.text: Let the rolls sit for a few minutes, while you make the icing or frosting of choice. Frost and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the rolls sit for a few minutes, while you make the icing or frosting of choice. Frost and serve.
